It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and delicate, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along forest floors or in rocky crevices. Its botanical structure includes a short stem with few branches and a root system adapted to nutrient-poor soils.
